content:
Hello guys, I'm kinda new to contributing to open source projects, I'm gonna be straight: I'm following the ib program in my school, and contributing to open source projects counts as CAS experience(basically things that I need to do which are not related to school), and since I love rust, and it has a whole book describing how to contribute to it, I thought that it would be the perfect opportunity.
But I'm not just doing it for school, I love rust and programming in general.
I'm just 16 but I have experience in coding(my hardest project in rust, i'm also pretty experienced in python and have pretty strong general programming foundamentals).
Can someone point me to a relatively easy issue so that I can try to help?

Welcome to Rust! If you're looking for something easy https://github.com/rust-lang/docs.rs/issues/1013 is a good choice, it's mostly just looking through PRs but it would be super helpful for documenting changes to docs.rs
Welcome! If you found CHIP-8 fun, rustc also has an interpreter inside that it uses for constant evaluation. You can check out #t-compiler/const-eval if you're interested in that.
Thanks I will check out both links and see!
@Joshua Nelson I know that this part of the project is important too, but do you have any suggestions for any code related issue?
You can start with issues tagged E-easy or E-mentor, they are generally cleanup work that is very nice to get used to the codebase
@Alessandro Ferrari We also have many issues in the Cargo project that have a spec but need implementing.
@Alessandro Ferrari Are you looking for an issue that just needs someone to write code, or a project where you can do some design work and then write the code?
And other issues where someone needs to write a spec and then the code.
I think that just writing the code would be easier, so I'd prefer to start with that
https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/issues/8790 should be fairly straightforward to code as a starting point for getting into Cargo.

It looks like https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/issues/8790 has been already fixed (cargo/src/cargo/ops/cargo_clean.rs line 32),
but the issue is still up on github
